jx.jx_en_mean: do or be willing to do anything, no matter how wrong it is, in order to achieve one's objective
jx.jx_cn_mean: 出卖灵魂；做昧良心的事

lj.lj_ly: universities and polytechnics are selling their souls for commercial success.
lj.lj_ls: 大学和工科院校正在为获取商业利益而做昧良心的事情。

jx.jx_en_mean: To get rid of by selling, often at reduced prices.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 甩卖：卖掉，出售通常是降低出售

jx.jx_en_mean: To put all of one's goods or possessions up for sale.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 出盘，盘店：把所有贷物或财产全部出售

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To betray one's cause or colleagues
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 出卖：出卖了自己的理想或同事

lj.lj_ly: He sold out to the other side.
lj.lj_ls: 他出卖自己投靠到另一方去

jx.jx_en_mean: To underestimate the true value or worth of

lj.lj_ly: Don't sell your colleague short; she's a smart lawyer.
lj.lj_ls: 别低估你的同事；她可是个精明的律师

entry.def: If you sell something that you own, you let someone have it in return for money.

example.ex: I sold everything I owned except for my car and my books...
example.tran: 我把我所有的东西都卖掉了，只剩下汽车和书。

example.ex: His heir sold the painting to the London art dealer Agnews...
example.tran: 他的继承人把这幅画卖给了伦敦艺术品经销商阿格纽斯。

entry.def: If a shop sells a particular thing, it is available for people to buy there.

example.ex: It sells everything from hair ribbons to oriental rugs...
example.tran: 这里出售各种商品，从发带到东方小地毯应有尽有。

example.ex: Bean sprouts are also sold in cans.

entry.def: If something sells for a particular price, that price is paid for it.

example.ex: Unmodernised property can sell for up to 40 per cent of its modernised market value.
example.tran: 没有装备现代化设施的房地产能够卖到它配置了现代化设施情况下的市价的 40%。

example.ex: ... grain sells at 10 times usual prices.
example.tran: 粮食售价是平常的 10 倍。

entry.def: If something sells, it is bought by the public, usually in fairly large quantities.

example.ex: Even if this album doesn't sell and the critics don't like it, we wouldn't ever change...
example.tran: 即使这张专辑得不到市场和评论家的青睐，我们也不会作出任何改变。

example.ex: The company believes the products will sell well in the run-up to Christmas.
example.tran: 这个公司相信这些产品在圣诞节前夕一定会畅销。

entry.def: Something that sells a product makes people want to buy the product.

example.ex: It is only the sensational that sells news magazines.
example.tran: 只有轰动性的事件才能促进新闻杂志的销售。

example.ex: ...car manufacturers' long-held maxim that safety doesn't sell.
example.tran: 汽车生产商长期奉行的座右铭——安全性并不意味着畅销

entry.def: If you sell someone an idea or proposal, or sell someone on an idea, you convince them that it is a good one.

example.ex: She tried to sell me the idea of buying my own paper shredder...
example.tran: 她努力说服我买一台自己的碎纸机。

example.ex: She is hoping she can sell the idea to clients...
example.tran: 她希望能让客户们接受这个想法。

entry.def: If someone sells their body, they have sex for money.

example.ex: 85 per cent said they would rather not sell their bodies for a living.
example.tran: 85%的人说如果存在其他选择，他们不会出卖肉体谋生。

entry.def: If someone sells you down the river, they betray you for some personal profit or advantage.
entry.tran: (为获得个人利益或好处而)出卖，背叛

example.ex: He has been sold down the river by the people who were supposed to protect him.
example.tran: 他被那些本应该保护他的人出卖了。

entry.def: If you sell someone short, you do not point out their good qualities as much as you should or do as much for them as you should.

example.ex: They need to improve their image — they are selling themselves short...
example.tran: 他们需要提升自己的形象——他们是在自贬身价。

example.ex: Selling their fans short in such a shabby way is not acceptable.
example.tran: 如此过分地怠慢他们的崇拜者令人无法接受。

entry.def: If you talk about someone selling their soul in order to get something, you are criticizing them for abandoning their principles.

example.ex: ...a man who would sell his soul for political viability.
example.tran: 为了升官晋爵甘愿出卖良心的人

means.word_mean: 1. the activity of persuading someone to buy;
1. exchange or deliver for money or its equivalent;

sentences.sentence: "She sells her body to survive and support her drug habit"

means.word_mean: 2. be sold at a certain price or in a certain way;
3. do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood;
4. persuade somebody to accept something;

sentences.sentence: "The French try to sell us their image as great lovers"

means.word_mean: 5. give up for a price or reward;

sentences.sentence: "She sold her principles for a successful career"

means.word_mean: 6. deliver to an enemy by treachery;
7. be approved of or gain acceptance;

sentences.sentence: "The new idea sold well in certain circles"

means.word_mean: 8. be responsible for the sale of;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sellan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse selja 'give up, sell'. Early use included the sense 'give, hand (something) over voluntarily in response to a request'

sentences.cn: 那种拙劣的推销术也逐渐有所改变,显得比较体面、正派了.
sentences.en: Gradually the crude early selling methods changed and became more respectable too.

sentences.cn: 真正的好交易不需要使用硬推销术.
sentences.en: The really good deals don't need the hard sell treatment.

sentences.cn: 他们用硬推销术宣传这本书, 每天晚上都在电视上卖广告.
sentences.en: They're certainly giving the book the hard sell, with advertisements every night on TV.

sentences.cn: 没有生气的市场也在一定程度上表明，银行系统已经瘫痪。由于担心账面损失，银行既不会出售资产，也不愿购买那些所谓的廉价资产。
sentences.en: And dead markets partly reflect the paralysis of banks which will not sell assets for fear of booking losses, yet are reluctant to buy all those supposed bargains.

sentences.cn: 几乎所有接受过这个特别报道采访的人都说，目前最大的问题不是没有需求， 而是缺乏可以出售的好作品。
sentences.en: Almost everyone who was interviewed for this special report said that the biggest problem at the moment is not a lack of demand but a lack of good work to sell.

sentences.cn: 但是无需出售作品的人却都在远离市场，期待着自信的回归。
sentences.en: But anyone who does not have to sell is keeping away, waiting for confidence to return.
